content:
• Monday, April 2, 2012
  • DDD

    3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) +3.7% AH on news it will be joining the S&P SmallCap 600 after...

    3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) +3.7% AH on news it will be joining the S&P SmallCap 600 after Thursday's close. The company will be replacing Taleo (NASDAQ:TLEO), which is being acquired by Oracle.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • SBAC

    SBA Communications (NASDAQ:SBAC) files a secondary offering to sell 5.25M shares of common stock...

    SBA Communications (NASDAQ:SBAC) files a secondary offering to sell 5.25M shares of common stock for holders. BofA Merrill Lynch is acting as sole underwriter for the offering. Shares -2.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • XSPA

    Shares of development-stage mobile phone software maker Vringo (VRNG +87.9%) nearly doubled...

    Shares of development-stage mobile phone software maker Vringo (VRNG +87.9%) nearly doubled today, apparently thanks to a weekend article by TechCrunch’s James Altucher, in which he argues VRNG might stand to gain billions of dollars in a patent suit against Google (GOOG +0.9%) that could send shares of the search giant "to $0."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • MRVL

    Cavium (CAVM) says Q1 results will miss guidance, coming in approximately 6% to 7% lower than...

    Cavium (CAVM) says Q1 results will miss guidance, coming in approximately 6% to 7% lower than revenue in Q4. The company notes revenues during the Q1 increased sequentially in its enterprise and data center markets, but declined in its service provider and broadband and consumer markets due to inventory de-stocking and delays in program depoyments. Shares -3.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • MITK

    Share of mobile imaging software firm Mitek (MITK -19.2%) plunged in late trading, after the...

    Share of mobile imaging software firm Mitek (MITK -19.2%) plunged in late trading, after the United Services Automobile Association, a customer, filed suit against the company. The USAA claims its mobile checking solution doesn't infringe Mitek's patents, which are pivotal to Mitek's Mobile Deposit offering, and accuses the company of breach of contract and fraud.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 4 Comments
  • MSG

    Shares of Madison Square Garden (MSG +1.5%) finish the day higher after Needham upped its Q3...

    Shares of Madison Square Garden (MSG +1.5%) finish the day higher after Needham upped its Q3 estimates earlier today to $0.10 from $0.01, citing the improving performance of the Knicks and Rangers.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • FTR

    Frontier Communications (FTR +2.6%) finishes the day higher after Nomura upgraded the shares to...

    Frontier Communications (FTR +2.6%) finishes the day higher after Nomura upgraded the shares to Buy on valuation earlier today, citing potential progress on refinancing its debt portfolio.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • PETS

    After shares climbed ~40% since November, Piper Jaffray gives up the bear case on PetMed Express...

    After shares climbed ~40% since November, Piper Jaffray gives up the bear case on PetMed Express (PETS +5.3%), upgrading its rating to Neutral, raising its price target to $12 and boosting estimates for this year and next. The firm says the outlook for the online pet medicine company isn't "as dire as previously expected heading into seasonally strong part of the year."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • ININ

    Call center software vendor Interactive Intelligence (ININ +3.6%) posts a healthy gain after...

    Call center software vendor Interactive Intelligence (ININ +3.6%) posts a healthy gain after acquiring Dutch reseller Brightware for an undisclosed sum. In January, the company acquired South African reseller ATIO.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • AONEQ

    Shares of lithium ion battery maker A123 Systems (AONE -9.8%) sink to a new 52-week low and...

    Shares of lithium ion battery maker A123 Systems (AONE -9.8%) sink to a new 52-week low and remain hovering near $1, continuing the fallout from last week's recall of modules and battery packs installed in luxury electric vehicles manufactured by Fisker Automotive. Fisker recently has secured more than $1B in new financing.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • OA

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK +3.9%) is raised to Overweight at J.P. Morgan, which says the defense...

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK +3.9%) is raised to Overweight at J.P. Morgan, which says the defense contractor's reduced earnings outlook is more than fully priced into the stock. Last month, Alliant predicted FY 2013 results would fall short of Wall Street expectations due to near-term growth challenges, and shares have dropped steeply ever since.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • BRKR

    Bruker (BRKR +4.8%) acquires Belgium-based scientific instruments company SkyScan; terms are not...

    Bruker (BRKR +4.8%) acquires Belgium-based scientific instruments company SkyScan; terms are not disclosed, but the acquisition is expected to add ~$13M to Bruker's revenue and to be accretive to EPS by about $0.01 for remainder of FY12.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • AINV

    Apollo Investment (AINV +4.6%) says Apollo Global Management (APO +0.8%) purchased about $50M,...

    Apollo Investment (AINV +4.6%) says Apollo Global Management (APO +0.8%) purchased about $50M, or about 5.9 million shares, of newly issued Apollo Investment stock amid plans to expand its focus. Separately, the firm adds that it's beginning a search for a new chief financial officer after its earlier choice was unable to join the company due to a scheduling conflict.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • NVO

    Shares of Danish pharma Novo Nordisk (NVO +5.8%) surge after it announces FDA approval of its...

    Shares of Danish pharma Novo Nordisk (NVO +5.8%) surge after it announces FDA approval of its Levemir drug for pregnant women with diabetes after finding it did not increase the risk to unborn babies. NVO says it's now "the only company that offers a complete portfolio of insulin analogs" with this approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • HTS

    Hatteras Financial (HTS +1.1%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at BofA/Merrill, citing a...

    Hatteras Financial (HTS +1.1%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at BofA/Merrill, citing a more favorable interest rate back drop.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • LLTC

    In addition to its downgrade of Linear Technology (LLTC -1.6%), UBS is cutting analog peer Texas...

    In addition to its downgrade of Linear Technology (LLTC -1.6%), UBS is cutting analog peer Texas Instruments (TXN -1.3%) to Neutral. The firm notes the mobile infrastructure market (20% of TI's sales) remains weak, and that the industrial market (18% of sales) is being held back by soft Chinese demand. The firm is more bullish on rivals ADI and MXIM, which it thinks have better operating leverage.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • RDEN

    Elizabeth Arden (RDEN +2.7%) gains after being upgraded to Outperform on valuation at BMO...

    Elizabeth Arden (RDEN +2.7%) gains after being upgraded to Outperform on valuation at BMO Capital, citing the company's upcoming brand repositioning with its new Visible Difference line as a catalyst. The firm also raises its price target to $44 from $41.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • TWER

    Canaccord ups its price target on Towerstream (TWER +9.5%) following the announcement of its...

    Canaccord ups its price target on Towerstream (TWER +9.5%) following the announcement of its first Wi-Fi agreement with a national carrier for current and future rooftop assets. The firm also raises estimates, adding the announcement could lead to other deals.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • SINA

    Off sharply premarket thanks to the Chinese government's crackdown, Sina (SINA -1.5%) has...

    Off sharply premarket thanks to the Chinese government's crackdown, Sina (SINA -1.5%) has rebounded. Helping its cause is Deutsche, which notes Sina and Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) got off lighter than many other firms, and users are still able to exchange opinions while restrictions are in place. The firm adds significant Weibo defections are unlikely given "there is no other online/offline media that offers customized content subscription in China."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • HUN

    Shares of Huntsman (NYSE:HUN) are up 3.1% on above-average volume after DealReporter tips off...

    Shares of Huntsman (NYSE:HUN) are up 3.1% on above-average volume after DealReporter tips off that the company has hired BofA to help explore a possible sale of itself.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 2 Comments
  • XLS

    Exelis (XLS -2.7%) slips after JP Morgan cut the shares to Neutral on valuation earlier today....

    Exelis (XLS -2.7%) slips after JP Morgan cut the shares to Neutral on valuation earlier today. Shares of the aerospace and defense stock are up 38% year-to-date, fueled by pension optics.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • VLTR

    Volterra (VLTR -2%) trades down after Caris cut the shares to Average on valuation, citing the...

    Volterra (VLTR -2%) trades down after Caris cut the shares to Average on valuation, citing the stock's recent 55% jump since late November. The firm notes positive estimate revisions are already baked into shares somewhat as a result of strong March PC order data points.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks (SBUX +1.5%) says it will triple the number of its stores in China in the next three...

    Starbucks (SBUX +1.5%) says it will triple the number of its stores in China in the next three years, jumping from 500 currently to more than 1,500 in 2015 in more than 70 Chinese cities, as expansion through smaller cities is “most definitely” a viable way to grow. China offers the “highest financial return” among all markets, Asia Pacific chief John Culver says.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • LL

    After surging 60% since mid-December amid hopes of turnaround and signs of an improved housing...

    After surging 60% since mid-December amid hopes of turnaround and signs of an improved housing market, Lumber Liquidators (LL -2.5%) moves back from last week's nine-month high after Stifel Nicolaus cut the closeout flooring seller to hold on valuation. The firm says investors have gotten overly excited near-term as flooring sales in Q1 have only shown marginal improvement.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • DIN

    DineEquity (DIN -1.3%) trades lower after Raymond James cut the shares to Outperform, citing...

    DineEquity (DIN -1.3%) trades lower after Raymond James cut the shares to Outperform, citing softer industry sales trends and a likely slowdown in comp sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +2.3%) rallies after Topeka Capital's Brian White decides to one-up his many bullish...

    Apple (AAPL +2.3%) rallies after Topeka Capital's Brian White decides to one-up his many bullish peers by starting coverage with a $1,001 PT (no typo). White, who made plenty of positive remarks about Apple while at Ticonderoga Securities, praises Apple's brand for being "able to touch the soul of consumers of all backgrounds." He also thinks China and a TV set could help out some.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 12 Comments
  • KID

    Kid Brands (KID -3.1%) slips after Roth Capital cut the shares to Neutral earlier today, given...

    Kid Brands (KID -3.1%) slips after Roth Capital cut the shares to Neutral earlier today, given the retailer's challenging near-term results and cautious outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR -7.8%) shares sink after entering into an equity distribution...

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR -7.8%) shares sink after entering into an equity distribution agreement with Knight Capital America relating to an at-the-market offering of shares of its common stock having an aggregate sales price of up to $75M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • KERX

    Roth Capital downgrades Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (KERX -66.4%) to Neutral from Buy after the...

    Roth Capital downgrades Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (KERX -66.4%) to Neutral from Buy after the firm bombed with Phase 3 testing of its perifosine colon cancer drug. Analysts with the Roth take their price target on KERX down to $4 from $10 - which still stands well-above the current trading price of $1.67.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • ESRX

    Express Scripts (ESRX +3.3%) completes its $29.1B purchase of Medco (MHS -1.3%) following the...

    Express Scripts (ESRX +3.3%) completes its $29.1B purchase of Medco (MHS -1.3%) following the FTC's approval of the deal. Three senior Medco execs will join Express' top team, although that doesn't incldue Medco CEO David Snow. Despite its dispute with Express, Walgreen's (WAG +2.3%) contract with Medco will be honored.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • KSS

    Kohl's (KSS +2.2%) trades higher following an upgrade to Neutral from JPMorgan. The firm notes...

    Kohl's (KSS +2.2%) trades higher following an upgrade to Neutral from JPMorgan. The firm notes Kohl's has significantly underperformed its peer group and the broader market over the last 5 months, and is motivated to upgrade shares on account of both new sales initiatives and growing bearish sentiment (short interest as a % of float has doubled in the last 6 months).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • BB

    Research in Motion (RIMM -2.8%) U.S. sales “continued to deteriorate” in March,...

    Research in Motion (RIMM -2.8%) U.S. sales “continued to deteriorate” in March, Pacific Crest says, with RIM’s days of inventory now “well above 30 days, which we believe is more than 3x what the carriers would normally target... the highest DOI levels we have ever seen." Sales in Europe also look lower, "likely lead[ing] to subscriber losses in the next one to two quarters."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • LLTC

    Linear Technology (LLTC -2.5%) dips on a UBS downgrade to Neutral on valuation. Linear...

    Linear Technology (LLTC -2.5%) dips on a UBS downgrade to Neutral on valuation. Linear Technology citing valuation and a lack of near-term catalysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • KITD

    ThinkEquity says that the positive aspects of Kit Digital's (OTC:KITD +3.8%) delayed 10-K filing...

    ThinkEquity says that the positive aspects of Kit Digital's (OTC:KITD +3.8%) delayed 10-K filing outweigh its negative aspects, noting the company's Q4 financials remained essentially intact. The firm reiterates a $22 target and Buy rating on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • NORNQ

    Shares of Noranda Aluminum (NOR +6.1%) trade higher after the company catches an upgrade from...

    Shares of Noranda Aluminum (NOR +6.1%) trade higher after the company catches an upgrade from Bank of America to Buy from Hold on attractive valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • WG

    Oil services firm Willbros Group (WG +25.9%) bounces sharply off its 52-week lows after...

    Oil services firm Willbros Group (WG +25.9%) bounces sharply off its 52-week lows after reporting preliminary Q4 revenue of $404.9M (consensus is for #388.5M), and announcing it has been awarded a contract by Energy Transfer Partners to build a portion of its Red River Gathering pipeline. The rally comes even though Willbros is slightly delaying the filing of its 10-K, after finding a "material weakness existed in its controls."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • RNDY

    Shares of Roundy's Supermarkets (NYSE:RNDY) kick up a 6.2% gain after the company is added to...

    Shares of Roundy's Supermarkets (NYSE:RNDY) kick up a 6.2% gain after the company is added to the Russell 2000 Index.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • ANF

    Shares of Abercrombia & Fitch (ANF +3.1%) stir up a gain after analysts at Brean Murray upgrade...

    Shares of Abercrombia & Fitch (ANF +3.1%) stir up a gain after analysts at Brean Murray upgrade the company to Buy from Hold on a "compelling" risk/reward profile. Warm weather in the U.S. should help the retailer lighten its glut of inventory, notes Brean.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -11.9%) tumbles after analysts blast the company for its Q4 restatement. Stifel...

    Groupon (GRPN -11.9%) tumbles after analysts blast the company for its Q4 restatement. Stifel and BofA are issuing downgrades, with the latter predicting it will "take several quarters for Groupon to regain investor confidence." JPMorgan is more positive, arguing the restatement is reflective of "Groupon's dynamic deal mix and the company's extremely rapid growth in a very short amount of time." (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 4 Comments
  • ACOM

    Ancestry.com (ACOM +2.9%) lands a Buy rating from Craig-Hallum to accompany the firm's lofty...

    Ancestry.com (ACOM +2.9%) lands a Buy rating from Craig-Hallum to accompany the firm's lofty price target of $35 on shares. 7 out of 9 analysts covering the company on the Street now have ACOM slated at Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • GPN

    Lost in all the commotion surrounding the security breach at Global Payments (GPN -3.7%) is its...

    Lost in all the commotion surrounding the security breach at Global Payments (GPN -3.7%) is its FQ3 report that comes up short on earnings due to higher expenses. GPN reports EPS of $0.83 excluding non-recurring items, $0.01 worse than consensus; revenues rose 16.9% Y/Y to $533.5M vs. $529.4M consensus. GPN reaffirms FY 2012 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD -4.6%) and Panera Bread (PNRA -1.3%) sell off after Raymond James cuts...

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD -4.6%) and Panera Bread (PNRA -1.3%) sell off after Raymond James cuts the rapidly-growing fast-casual chains to Underperform. DineEquity (DIN -2.2%) and Darden (DRI -1%) have also been downgraded.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • HIG

    Hartford Financial (NYSE:HIG) +1.4% premarket after announcing it will pay $2.43B to buy back...

    Hartford Financial (NYSE:HIG) +1.4% premarket after announcing it will pay $2.43B to buy back debt and warrants issued to Allianz (OTCPK:AZSEY). The U.S. insurance company turned to Allianz, Germany’s largest insurer, for capital in 2008, agreeing to pay 10% on $1.75B of debt as capital markets froze; today's move allows HIG to replace the $1.75B it owes with new debt at a lower cost.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • ZIOP

    Zipharm Oncology (NASDAQ:ZIOP) +5.7% after providing positive Phase 3 trial data for its Picasso...

    Zipharm Oncology (NASDAQ:ZIOP) +5.7% after providing positive Phase 3 trial data for its Picasso 3 sarcoma drug. The results correlate with positive data reported in February. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • TWER

    Towerstream (NASDAQ:TWER) says in a SEC filing that it has an agreement for a national wireless...

    Towerstream (NASDAQ:TWER) says in a SEC filing that it has an agreement for a national wireless carrier to use its current and future rooftop assets. Shares +19.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM

  • Market Preview: S&P Benchmark futures are flat after the 500 climbed 12% in Q1, its best...

    Market Preview: S&P Benchmark futures are flat after the 500 climbed 12% in Q1, its best start to the year since 1998. More poor PMI and unemployment data out of Europe is raising fears about recession, while Chinese PMI was mixed. Avon +18.5% but down from earlier highs following its rejection of a $10B offer from Coty. Express Scripts +4% after the FTC OKs its merger with Medco. Later: ISM Manufacturing Index, Construction Spending, Fed's Pianalto
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • OSTK

    Shares of Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) trade up 5.1% after the SEC says it won't take any action...

    Shares of Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) trade up 5.1% after the SEC says it won't take any action against the company in connection to its restatement of financial statements from 2006 and 2008.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • SRPT

    AVI BioPharma (AVII) -31.8% premarket after saying a 24-week study showed its eteplirsen drug...

    AVI BioPharma (AVII) -31.8% premarket after saying a 24-week study showed its eteplirsen drug had a statistically significant effect in raising the level of a key protein, dystrophin, in boys with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, but patients given the drug for only 12 weeks showed no significant increase despite receiving higher doses. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • TWER

    Premarket gainers: TWER +20%. AVP +19%. RNDY +8%. MCP +4%. ESRX +4%. VVUS +3%.Losers: KERX -60%....

    Premarket gainers: TWER +20%. AVP +19%. RNDY +8%. MCP +4%. ESRX +4%. VVUS +3%.
    Losers: KERX -60%. AVII -32%. GRPN -10%. NBG -8%. GFA-OLD -6%. SINA -5%. IRE -4%. GOLD -4%. THLD -3%. MT -2%. BBVA -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • WWIN

    Winner Medical (NASDAQ:WWIN) +22.1% premarket after the Chinese exporter of medical dressings...

    Winner Medical (NASDAQ:WWIN) +22.1% premarket after the Chinese exporter of medical dressings and other products made of cotton said Chairman and CEO Jianquan Li offered to take the company private for $4.30/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • ESRX

    After coming off of a trading halt that followed an announcement of FTC approval for the Express...

    After coming off of a trading halt that followed an announcement of FTC approval for the Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX)-Medco Health (NYSE:MHS) merger, shares of both companies trade higher. ESRX +3.1% premarket, MHS +0.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • CXO

    Concho Resources (NYSE:CXO) +2.7% premarket after Deutsche Bank upgrades shares to Buy from...

    Concho Resources (NYSE:CXO) +2.7% premarket after Deutsche Bank upgrades shares to Buy from Hold, believing CXO has underperformed peers YTD on valuation concerns and rising costs, but "this has overshadowed upside drivers in Delaware Basin performance, emerging/improving plays... and potential for accretive acquisitions."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • SINA

    Shares of Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) trail off 6.3% in premarket trading after China cracks down on the...

    Shares of Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) trail off 6.3% in premarket trading after China cracks down on the ability of websites in the nation to have an open forum for commenting after a rumors of a coup d'etat ran wild last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • AVP

    Avon (NYSE:AVP) rejects a +$10B offer from Coty, saying that the deal is opportunistic and not...

    Avon (NYSE:AVP) rejects a +$10B offer from Coty, saying that the deal is opportunistic and not in the best interest of shareholders. Shares +20.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) is downgraded to Neutral at BAML, saying estimates for the company are too...

    Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) is downgraded to Neutral at BAML, saying estimates for the company are too high. The Street currently expects Q2 EPS guidance of $0.49, but ML believes it could be just $0.27. Shares -2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM
  • GSK

    GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) buys 10M shares of Theravance (THRX) at a price of $21.2887 a pop -...

    GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) buys 10M shares of Theravance (THRX) at a price of $21.2887 a pop - taking its stake in the asthma drug firm up to 26.8%. The transaction needs the approval of Theravance's stockholders before closing. Premarket: GSK +0.7%, THRX inactive.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM
  • AEZS

    Shares of Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) crater - down 63.1% premarket - after Keryx announces a...

    Shares of Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) crater - down 63.1% premarket - after Keryx announces a failure of its perifosince drug to meet endpoints in a Phase 3 clinical trial conducted at 65 U.S. sites. Aetenera Zentaris has a license agreement with Keryx over the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • KERX

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) announces that results from a Phase 3 trial of its...

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) announces that results from a Phase 3 trial of its perifosine drug failed to meet primary endpoints for improving survivability of patients with refractory advanced colorectal cancer. Shares -58.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM
  • AVP

    Coty proposes to buy Avon (NYSE:AVP) for $23.25 a share after it says it lined up debt and...

    Coty proposes to buy Avon (NYSE:AVP) for $23.25 a share after it says it lined up debt and equity financing to swing the deal. The offer is a 27% premium over a 3-month volume-weighted trading price for Avon. Shares of AVP +24.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:28 AM | 5 Comments
  • TOT

    Shares of Total (NYSE:TOT) move 1.2% higher in premarket trading after the French oil major...

    Shares of Total (NYSE:TOT) move 1.2% higher in premarket trading after the French oil major initiates more definitive steps to plug the gas well leaking in the North Sea with a dangerous flare at the site now extinguished.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 AM
